candidates.title: fix(deps): We use the serde feature from Url
candidates.body:
To use the serde feature from Url you must request the feature, which
can only be done by directly depending on the Url crate instead of
pulling it in via reqwest.

candidates.title: chore: update quic-rpc... again...
candidates.body: This is a minor update just to quiet down some logging.

candidates.title: chore: update quic-rpc
candidates.body: This should at least get rid of the errors when receiving empty frames

candidates.title: fix(iroh): handle connection refused errors with pretty messages again
candidates.body:
Bring back this message when nothings running:
```
$ iroh get foo
Error: Connection refused. Are services running?
hint: see 'iroh start' for more on starting services
```

Also pick up a neat little refactor that drops inner match statements

candidates.title: chore: update quic-rpc version
candidates.body:
This should give us better termination and also solve some issues with rpc messages being too large.

It probably allocates needlessly large buffers for each hyper connection, but that is preferable to getting errors. We will get rid of this with a subsequent quic-rpc update.

candidates.title: (chore): de-dupe axum
candidates.body: 0.6 is pulled by opentelemetry-otlp -> tonic

candidates.title: add back `iroh status -w` feature using new rpc streams
candidates.body: closes n0-computer/beetle#50

candidates.title: Use cargo's workspace.package and workspace.dependencies

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
This switches to use cargo's new workspace.package and
workspace.dependencies features.  It reduced duplication in the cargo
files.

A number of dependency versions where unified through this already.

candidates.title: fix: update quic-rpc to get rid of debug output
refactor(`iroh-api`): add takes a `UnixfsEntry` not a `Path`

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: a change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

candidates.body:
closes n0-computer/beetle#96 

- [x] re-export builder structs from `iroh-unixfs::builder`
- [x] allow building from a path in `DirectoryBuilder`
- [x] make `builder::Entry` public
- [x] refactor `add` to take an `Entry`
- [x] remove unneeded `add_file`, `add_symlink`, `add_dir` helper functions
- [x] adjust imports/tests/benches

candidates.title: Switch to quic-rpc
candidates.body:
This switches to quic-rpc with the hyper transport. Performance will be a bit better than before, but not astronomically so.

We should be able to get rid of the load balancers. But they are still in there. We can remove them in a subsequent PR.

Issues we should do immediately after merging this:
https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/53
https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/52
https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/51
https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/50

Another comment: a lot of the boilerplate in the types can be eliminated by the macros that are already in quic-rpc. I decided to go with the no macro approach for now because a) it is nice to see how it works under the hood b) I don't mind the boilerplate that much, compared to a somewhat intransparent macro.

I think in the long term we might want to use a macro do define the request/response enums and the traits for each case, but I think having the big ugly switch statement without a macro is good so we can customize the treatment for each request.

candidates.title: ref: Enable backtrace support in anyhow
candidates.body:
This enables backtrace support in anyhow, allowing backtraces to be
enabled when setting RUST_BACKTRACE=1.  This is useful when trying to
find the source of an error.

Updates the requirements on [nix](https://github.com/nix-rust/nix) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from nix's changelog.

[0.26.1] - 2022-11-29

Fixed

  • Fix UB with sys::socket::sockopt::SockType using SOCK_PACKET. (#1821)

[0.26.0] - 2022-11-29

Added

  • Added SockaddrStorage::{as_unix_addr, as_unix_addr_mut} (#1871)
  • Added MntFlags and unmount on all of the BSDs.
  • Added any() and all() to poll::PollFd. (#1877)
  • Add MntFlags and unmount on all of the BSDs. (#1849)
  • Added a Statfs::flags method. (#1849)
  • Added NSFS_MAGIC FsType on Linux and Android. (#1829)
  • Added sched_getcpu on platforms that support it. (#1825)
  • Added sched_getaffinity and sched_setaffinity on FreeBSD. (#1804)
  • Added line_discipline field to Termios on Linux, Android and Haiku (#1805)
  • Expose the memfd module on FreeBSD (memfd was added in FreeBSD 13) (#1808)
  • Added domainname field of UtsName on Android and Linux (#1817)
  • Re-export RLIM_INFINITY from libc (#1831)
  • Added syncfs(2) on Linux (#1833)
  • Added faccessat(2) on illumos (#1841)
  • Added eaccess() on FreeBSD, DragonFly and Linux (glibc and musl). (#1842)
  • Added IP_TOS SO_PRIORITY and IPV6_TCLASS sockopts for Linux (#1853)
  • Added new_unnamed and is_unnamed for UnixAddr on Linux and Android. (#1857)
  • Added SockProtocol::Raw for raw sockets (#1848)
  • added IP_MTU (IpMtu) IPPROTO_IP sockopt on Linux and Android. (#1865)

Changed

  • The MSRV is now 1.56.1 (#1792)

candidates.title: refactor: remove `ContentLoader` and `unixfs` from `iroh-resolver` package

labels.name: refactor
labels.description: a change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

candidates.body:
closes n0-computer/beetle#94 

Moves `unxifs` content into it's own crate, removing any references to `Resolver` in favor of using a `ContentLoader`.

`ContentLoader` has been moved into it's own crate as well, called `iroh-content`

Basic types that are used by both `unixfs` & `resolver` (as well as a few other crates), have also been moved into `iroh-content`.

The roundtrip tests that were formerly in `unixfs` have been moved to the `iroh-resolver` packages.

Because this involved adjusting code imports, this looks like it touches ALOT. However, the main bulk of the changes are in slimming down `iroh-resolver` & splitting those files into `iroh-unixfs` and `iroh-content`.

EDIT:

moved `iroh-content`/`iroh-content-loader` into `iroh-unixfs`

candidates.title: iroh-embed MVP
candidates.body:
This took long enough, but a minimalistic version of an iroh-embed with a working example.

The examples are refactored a bit to become real crates: reason is that it needs to compile without the `testing` feature of `iroh-api`.  The examples feature from cargo enables that unfortunately.  I think for now this is fine, once the dev profile does no longer swap out the real Api struct they can become more normal examples.

I'm particularly unhappy with the current way of configuring this - it's too easy to make mistakes.  There are a bunch of notes in the code still that need to be addressed.

# Todo for this PR

- [x] Default configuration should be isolated from system-installed iroh.
- [x] Configuration without iroh-one's `Config` object.
- [x] Explore splitting monolithic `Iroh` struct into separate `Store` and `P2p` nodes.

# Out of scope for this PR

But needed in followup PRs.

- HTTP & UDS Gateway.
- Allow hooking up prometheus metrics.
- Graceful shutdown instead of aborting tasks.
- An in-memory store.

candidates.title: (chore) Update libipld to 0.15
candidates.body: This removes the use of `prost` at build time. `cid` and `multihash` are also updated accordingly.

candidates.title: feat: Better support of Gateway Subdomain spec
candidates.body:
Added basic subdomain support by uplifting parameters extraction from `Host` header required for handlers.
DnsLink part of spec is not supported in this PR.

Related to n0-computer/beetle#78 

**Spec:**

- [x] HEAD, GET methods
- [x] DNSLink support
- [x] Redirection from Path methods to Subdomain methods (behaviour is configured by option)
- [x] X-Forwarded-Host support
- [x] X-Forwarded-Proto support

Current PR won't cover [URI router](https://github.com/ipfs/specs/blob/main/http-gateways/SUBDOMAIN_GATEWAY.md#uri-router), I believe it is better to implement in a separate PR.

candidates.title: feat: Support `eth` domains
candidates.body:
This PR does two things:
- Moved DNS resolver to dedicated struct and reused it instead of creation every time
- Added `resolver.cloudflare-eth.com` resolver for `.eth` domains as in Kubo for making possible to resolve Etherium domains. Ip addresses of resolver are hardcoded for avoiding excessive round-trip.

candidates.title: feat(gateway): Add about page
candidates.body:
Add an about page with a bit of package information.

---

I just found this useful locally as I learn how things work.  Maybe
others like it too.  If not, never mind.

candidates.title: feat(ci): improve protoc install & add code coverage checks
feat(unixfs): implement rabin based chunking
candidates.body:
- implements rabin based chunking (following kubo & dagger)
- add chunking options to the CLI and API

Closes n0-computer/beetle#69

candidates.title: feat: enable quic transport
chore(ci): Test more features and MSRV
candidates.body:
Adding explicit check and clippy steps for the default features,
because --all-features enables the "testing" feature which in turn
disables a bunch of production code.  Preferably we figure out how to
not make --all-features skip prod code like this, but this is a stop
gap in the mean time.

Adding an explicit MSRV check and removing the rust-toolchain file.
This means local dev will default to using the latest rust compiler
and we'll not be surprised by failing CI that worked locally.  The
explicit MSRV check makes it so that we at least notice when we break
this.

candidates.title: feat(p2p): dial MDNS peers
candidates.body:
- [x] upgrade libp2p to include the latest fixes to tokio-mdns
- [x] dial mdns peers when we discover them 

Fixes n0-computer/beetle#71

candidates.title: Rename the uds-gateway feature to http-uds-gateway
candidates.body:
I noticed that `iroh-one` could not start without a config file, because the gateway rpc_addr was not set. This was due to some confusion about the role of the `uds-gateway` feature in `iroh-one/src/config.rs`.

I can't blame people for being confused since it's not a very good name. This patch tries to improve the situation by:
- renaming the feature to the more explicit `http-uds-gateway`.
- use the same rpc addr by default in `iroh-one` as in `iroh-gateway`.

With these changes `iroh-one` can start without parameters as expected, and the usage of the configuration file is unchanged.

candidates.title: Add a CORS middleware
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/76

This uses the headers from the gateway config. `access-control-allow-headers` and `access-control-expose-headers` are usually the same so we allow omitting the second, less known one. Without it, headers specified in `access-control-allow-headers` are not visible in `fetch()` responses even if they are sent back.

candidates.title: fix: Switch to tempfile for temporary test directories
candidates.body:
This removes the testdir crate for a temprorary testing directory and
uses the tempfile crate instead.  It seems a transitive dependency for
testdir does not work on mac, which is kind of required for us.

candidates.title: feat(cli): Environment variables to override directories
candidates.body:
Adding the IROH_CONFIG_DIR, IROH_DATA_DIR and IROH_CACHE_DIR
environment variables to override the OS-dependent locations.

candidates.title: fix(iroh-store): `put_many` bug
candidates.body:
Fixes the following scenario: if you attempt to add a folder with some files, it adds fine. But if you add a new file to that folder and add it again, the store won't add the new file.

closes n0-computer/beetle#114

candidates.title: fix(cli): Respect the --cfg flag
candidates.body:
Use the --cfg flag to load the configuration file for `iroh`.

This does not affect the config files for any of the managed
processes like iroh-p2p etc.

This flag was not used before.

Also optimises the make_config call a little by taking a slice
rather than a Vec.  And assert and document the priority order.

candidates.title: chore(deps): Unify the anyhow version dependency
candidates.body:
Since iroh is a library, or will be, we should not have too strict a
version requirement, so simply requiring version 1.

candidates.title: refactor(ops): CI rework

labels.name: ops
labels.description: operational infrastructure (hardware, deployments) concerns, excluding continuous integration

candidates.body:
**DO NOT MERGE EVEN AFTER APPROVAL/REVIEW**

Move completely over to Github Actions. The reasoning is mainly to consolidate and to shift to self hosted runners. CircleCI self hosted runners don't allow for forks to run builds.
We've also enforces mandatory approval for all external PRs. Moving forward please review changes to CI code carefully.

Results:
- own infra
- much speed
- less checks to wait for
- less maintenance / CI code

Things that will be done in a follow up PR:
- add more runners, specifically switch over windows builds to self hosted and swap mac from intel based to m1 based platforms

candidates.title: feat: dockerize iroh services
candidates.body:
~~building this in arm64 first because compiling amd64 on an M1 mac is slow to the point of not working. This'll take a while to get into a usable place, but I'd welcome any feedback / input / docker tips along the way~~

Update: I think this is in a pretty good spot for review. Seems to work well on my machine, going to try these same Dockerfiles on an an x86 machine tonight.

As with all docker nonsense, this is more searching the web & waiting on compilation than actually doing anything. My main article was [How to Create Small Docker Images For Rust](https://kerkour.com/rust-small-docker-image). I steered away from alpine after reading [this article on the slowness of the MUSL allocator](https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/testing-alternative-c-memory-allocators-pt-2-musl-mystery-gomes), which alpine relies upon. I haven't tested if those numbers are real.

So far the [distroless project](https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/distroless) has been nice to work with.

candidates.title: test(iroh-p2p): test interactions between multiple nodes
candidates.body:
covers these `RpcMessages`

- ExternalAddrs
- LocalPeerId
- ProviderRequest
- StartProviding
- StopProviding
- NetListeningAddrs
- NetPeers
- NetConnectByPeerId
- NetConnect
- Gossipsub messages
- FindPeerOnDht
- LookupPeerInfo
- ListenForIdentify
- AddressesOfPeer

The missing tests are for:
- P2pClient::fetch_bitswap
- P2pClient::notify_new_blocks_bitswap
- P2pClient::stop_session_bitswap
- P2pClient::disconnect -> this isn't actually implemented
- P2pClient::shutdown -> this doesn't seem to do anything

The bitswap commands are a bit trickier to fake. I would like to either move on or tackle them in a separate PR.

closes n0-computer/beetle#99

candidates.title: fix: Correct dependencies and build checks
candidates.body:
Fixes some CI commands to check all code by enabling all features and
checking more parts of the code.

As a result fixes the dependencies of the uds-gateway feature and
switches it from the deprecated tempdir to tempfile.

Makes the version spec of tempfile consistent between all the
workspace crates.

Fixes a clippy warning about cloning a bool, which is Copy.

Finally a few extra changes in ci.yml which the linter was complaining
about.

candidates.title: Make store operations atomic
candidates.body:
This makes store operations atomic by just using an in memory mutex.

This means that as soon as a db is being opened twice at the same time, it will be corrupted. But that is the case anyway because we are already relying on in process atomicity with the (former) AtomicU64 for the id counter.

I am working on a solution that is using rocksdb transactions on a separate branch, but it seems that this will take a bit longer because I can't get the atomicity test to pass despite using transactions with snapshots.

So this is a stopgap measure that makes our store not break until we sort things out more permanently.

It also implements https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle/issues/112 

Note: I tried using tokio async mutexes, but that gets you into trouble again because LocalStore is not Send.

candidates.title: ref(lru-cache): Change lru cache crate to avoid vulnerable dependency
candidates.body:
Change the LRU cache from the caches crate to the lru crate.  This crate is much simpler and does not depend on a vulnerable version of the time crate, resolving our cargo-audit issues.

A benchmark is included showing our use of the LRU cache to have no notable performance difference between both crates.


Closes n0-computer/beetle#131

candidates.title: feat: indexer resolution
candidates.body: supersedes #416. Using a separate PR to keep things comparable. Updating this branch changed a lifetime parameter that has me somewhat concerned.

candidates.title: Clean up dependencies
candidates.body:
This contains two commits:

- Removes unused dependencies.
- Sorts dependencies in Cargo.tom files.

This is meant to be committed without squashing, see the commit messages for details.

If the 2nd commit is too controversial I'm happy to remove it.

chosen_detail.title: fix(deps): We use the serde feature from Url
chosen_detail.body:
To use the serde feature from Url you must request the feature, which
can only be done by directly depending on the Url crate instead of
pulling it in via reqwest.
